intro: Polygala galapageia var. galapageia, commonly known as the Galapagos milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It is a member of the Polygalaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to the island's environment.
